body:
> Don't submit code to Gerrit (even for review) using your personal email address which is owned by corporations, until that corporation is in our AUTHORS files.

There is nothing about waiting until that corporation is in the AUTHORS file on the contribution guidelines page. In fact, it states that `These files will be periodically updated based on the commit logs.`: http://golang.org/doc/contribute.html

> Can you clarify which commits or directories or topics of commits written by Aram Hăvărneanu <*@mgk.ro> are owned by Oracle?

I will let Aram confirm his own, but all of mine were submitted using an oracle.com email address and for which a CLA was in place at the time they were submitted (Gerrit won't let you upload review until CLA is in place, I know this from experience).  But to be explicit those are:

From golang/go:
```
commit 4f74de1e4d8ac8382d866d9918059144218da069
Author: Shawn Walker-Salas <shawn.walker@...>
Date:   Wed Aug 26 15:24:41 2015 -0700
cmd/go: fix Go buildid reading on Solaris

commit d9e3d16796927ae2c5721cdff855ddb07a903d78
Author: Shawn Walker-Salas <shawn.walker@...>
Date:   Thu Jul 30 13:32:55 2015 -0700
runtime, syscall: remove unused bits from Solaris implementation
```

From x/sys/unix:
```
commit 339fc2ca4bac09124d756f897fb8698e26b5a844
Date:   Thu Aug 6 19:57:13 2015 -0700
Author: Shawn Walker-Salas <shawn.walker@...>
unix: update to use direct linking on Solaris
```
